value.name: 'Sick date-rape joke is proof Home Secretary James Cleverly has to go'
value.description: The Sunday Mirror says James Cleverly should know better after it was revealed the Home Secretary made a 'joke' about giving Rohypnol to his wife

value.name: Boost for Rishi Sunak as 'Santa rally' increases hopes of tax cuts in Spring Budget providing dose of optimism for struggling families
value.description: Rising share values are a signal of optimism on markets and will bring a dose of Christmas cheer to millions of British savers - including those with pension plans - and business leaders.

value.name: Cameron insists he will play no role in review of UAE-backed Telegraph takeover
value.description: Foreign Secretary says review of a takeover involving Abu Dhabi is entirely a matter for Lucy Frazer, the Culture Secretary

value.name: Stories of our times
value.description: There he encounters a young woman from the streets,... This weekend, Rishi Sunak was in Rome meeting Italy's prime minister Giorgia Meloni. As well as being a fan of the British PM, she's also a devotee of one of the UK's most famous writers - author of ...

value.name: Cameron warns of ‘destructive’ potential of small boats issue
value.description: In a Telegraph interview, Lord Cameron suggested the Foreign Office could do more to support Rishi Sunak’s promise to “stop the boats”. South Korean President state visit to the UK Lord Cameron backed Rishi Sunak’s drive to ‘stop the boats’ He ...

value.name: James Cleverly joked about giving wife date-rape drug after announcing new spiking law
value.description: Now angry campaigners – battling a crime they described as an epidemic in a parliamentary inquiry last year – are calling on Rishi Sunak to investigate his Cabinet minister’s behaviour. Colin Mackie, chair of Spike Aware UK, who lost a child through ...

value.name: Rishi Sunak Accused Of 'Weakness' By Tory MPs Over Immigration Climbdown
value.description: Rishi Sunak has been accused of “weakness” as he faced an angry Tory backlash over his latest climbdown. The prime minister confirmed that visa changes designed to reduce immigration have been delayed by a year until 2025.

value.name: NHS England boss ‘fearful’ for patients during junior doctor strikes
value.description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak branded the action “disappointing” and urged junior doctors to call off strikes. The next strike will begin at 7am on January 3 and end at 7am on January 9. It will be the longest strike in the 75-year history of the NHS.

value.name: Bold NHS reform won’t grab voters who can’t see a GP, Labour warned
value.description: When Rishi Sunak reaches the first anniversary of the five pledges he made to voters on 4 January, he may not wish to dwell too heavily on his promise to cut NHS waiting lists. The landmark lands in the middle of a six-day strike by junior doctors ...

value.description: PM was considering announcing measures restricting arrival of foreign workers in the autumn, but waited until December

value.name: Rishi Sunak defends visa clampdown delay after Tory criticism
value.description: The Prime Minister restated his intention to implement stricter UK visa rules for overseas family members, despite facing criticism from within the Tory party.

value.name: Tory donor who paid for Rishi Sunak’s private jet faces legal challenge over business dealings
value.description: Entrepreneur Akhil Tripathi, who made his fortune inventing an anti-snoring device, has donated more than £150,000 to the Conservative Party since 2021

video.name: Tory donor who paid for Rishi Sunak’s private jet faces legal challenge over business dealings

value.name: James Dyson praises Liz Truss in stinging swipe at Rishi Sunak as UK on brink of recession
value.description: Recent stats show the UK economy shrank in the last quarter, painting a damning image of Mr Sunak's current economic strategy.

value.name: Rail is on track for managed decline, with fare rises only part of the problem
value.description: On the east coast mainline, which connects London King’s Cross with Yorkshire, northeast England and Scotland, LNER cancelled and curtailed a number of trains on Saturday, again because of crew shortages. This was particularly significant because King’s Cross station is closed on Christmas Eve due to engineering work.

value.name: James Dyson accuses Rishi Sunak of not ‘going for growth’ as UK at risk of recession
value.description: Sir James Dyson has lashed out at Rishi Sunak and Jeremy Hunt, accusing the government of not “ going for growth ”. The billionaire inventor said wealth generation and growth have become “dirty words” under the prime minister and chancellor’s leadership.

value.name: James Dyson criticises Tories for not ‘going for growth’ after fall in GDP
value.description: The remarks come after the latest economic assessment revealed gross domestic product (GDP) fell by 0.1% in the third quarter, rather than the previous estimate of no growth, dealing a blow to the prime minister, Rishi Sunak, who had pledged economic ...
